comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: General Jose Santos Zelaya (white mustache), liberal former President (1893-1909) of Nicaragua, roused from sleep in the nighttime, arrested in New York City by U. S. Marshall Henkel on a charge of murder, and incarcerated in The Tombs jail, pursuant to an extradition treaty with the government of Nicaragua. Zelaya had been tried and convicted in absentia of murder, by the regime of his successors in Nicaragua. [Zelaya died in 1919, in New York City.] New York Times story of Zelaya's arrest, November 28, 1913: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=940DE7D61E3BE633A... An incomplete biography of Zelaya in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%c3%a9_Santos_Zelaya

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
LOC -- This is Henkel AND Zelaya. Bain's caption reads "Henkel -- Zelaya." Omitting the dash suggests that it is the name of a single individual.

Bain/LOC photo of Zelaya under arrest, posted on May 7, 2010:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4586899944/in/photostream/]

Yet another Bain/LOC photo of Zelaya under arrest, posted on May 14, 2010:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4605959221/]
